title: Site-17 Deepwell Catalog
content:
[[div style="display: none;"]]
[[include component:image-block name=https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/placeholder-mcd-s-authorpage/s17_purp.png|caption=.]]
[[/div]]

[[include :scp-wiki:theme:foxtrot
dark=a|
wide=a|
hidetitle=a]]

[[module CSS]]
@import url('https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/local--files/scp-8980/departuremono.css');

:root {
  --header-title: "SITE-17 DEEPWELL";
  --logo-img: url(https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/placeholder-mcd-s-authorpage/s17_purp.png);

  --head-font: var(--ui-font);

  --accent: 153, 119, 238;
}

@media (max-width: 768px) {
  :root {
    --header-title: "DEEPWELL" !important;
  }
}

@media (min-width: 768px) {
  #main-content {
   max-width: 98%;
  }

  #header h1 a::before {
    letter-spacing: 5px;
  }

  #header h2::before {
    letter-spacing: 2px;
  }
}

#page-content :is(h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6) {
  text-transform: uppercase;
}

body {
  background: #080016 !important;
}

.notation {
  width: 75%;
  margin: auto;
  background: rgb(20, 20, 20) !important;
}

/* excerpt div stuff */

.excerpt {
  --link-txt-color: rgb(var(--accent));

  border: solid 2px rgb(var(--accent));
  border-left-width: 10px;
  padding: 1px 15px;
  width: 75%;
  margin: auto;
  margin-top: 20px;
  margin-bottom: 20px;
  background: var(--dark-bg-2);
}

@media (max-width: 479px) {
  .excerpt {
    width: auto;
    margin-left: 0;
    margin-right: 0;
  }
}

/* replacing wikidot syntax for centering/size */

.excerpt > p:first-child {
  text-align: center;
  font-size: 80%;
}

.excerpt p:first-child > strong:first-of-type,
.excerpt p:first-child > em {
  font-size: 125%;
}

.excerpt:not(.hub) > hr ~ p {
  font-style: italic;
}

/* excerpt border colors */

.lifeless {
  --accent: 85, 153, 255;
}

.white-space {
  --accent: 0, 204, 51;
}

.admonition {
  --accent: var(--five-color);
}

.other {
  --accent: 204, 204, 204;
}
.other .excerpt {
  --link-txt-color: rgb(153, 119, 238);
}

/* section header stuff */

.section-header {
  border-bottom: 2px solid rgb(var(--accent));
  margin: 50px 0 15px;
}
.section-header h1 {
  margin-bottom: 2px;
}
[[/module]]

[[=]]
[[module Rate]]
[[/=]]

----

@@ @@

[[==]]
[[div class="notation"]]
The Foundation is a global, clandestine organization with an iron grip on all media, literature, and public knowledge. They operate within a strict hierarchy of Researcher to Site Director to Overseer to ensure that humanity remains in perpetual and blissful ignorance. They will and have contained God, and no one seems to care.

= [[span class="bt"]]Everything is as it must be.[[/span]]
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="notation"]]
Site-17 is the second-largest Foundation containment facility, housing hundreds of researchers and containing twice as many anomalies. Corruption has slowly festered within its ranks. The embodiment of the anomalous is knocking on reality's door. Someone has stopped to listen to a humanoid's sobbing.

= [[span class="bt"]]Is everything as it must be?[[/span]]
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="notation"]]
Site-17 is on the brink. There is always the slowly-beating thrum of anticipation, always the knowledge of something bigger, always the end just out of reach. So keep your head down, and your nose to the grindstone. You don't have to like what we do here; you just have to do it. If you start having dreams, consult a psychiatrist. If you start feeling ill, look past the blood. If you start losing your memories, don't bother. That's just how it is in this place.

= [[span class="bt"]]Nothing is as it should be.[[/span]]
[[/div]]
[[/==]]

@@ @@

[[div class="section-header"]]
+* Stories
[[/div]]

Deepwell is loosely stratified into series and standalone works; below are the canon's standalone works, followed by its series in their recommended reading order.

@@ @@

SCP-4855 is a 74 year-old African-American female, legally named Ms. Edwina Drake, of â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ, North Dakota. SCP-4855 is immune to informational, psychological, memetic, and antimemetic anomalies.

[[div class="excerpt"]]
**[[[SCP-7791]]]:** //ï½Žï½…ï½ƒï½…ï½“ï½“ï½ï½’ï½™ ï½…ï½–ï½‰ï½Œ//

**[[[SCP-7356]]]:** //Noncanonical Materials//
by **FLOORBOARDS**
----
Those in the presence of SCP-7356 have not reported adverse effects. However, assigned ritualists â€” even those who had been amnesticized â€” have reported experiencing dreams depicting an unknown species of bird, possibly a crow or raven, gliding down a hallway.
[[/div]]

[[div class="excerpt"]]
**[[[justifying-means-justifying-means|Justifying Means Justifying Means ]]]**

And yet, in my endless hate for hatred itself, I came to love You, O blaspheme of nature.

It is currently theorized that the critical levels of Akiva radiation within Sector-13D caused some manner of **{{[REDACTED BY ORDER OF THE SCP-8413 INVESTIGATIVE TEAM]}}**.

**[[[scp-8980|SCP-8980]]]:** //Ergophobia: Without Regards//
by **Yossipossi**
----
= [[span style="font-family: 'Departure Mono'; font-size: 85%;"]]The following file is undergoing active Ethics Committee investigation for violation of the SCP Foundation's Code of Conduct. Information contained therein may not accurately reflect reality and this document should not be considered a reliable source.[[/span]]
[[/div]]

by **Mechatroniks**

You know? Standing there like nothing had happened wasâ€¦ the most painful and liberating experience in my entire life. I couldn't die, but I also didn't have to worry about risks or if there was an afterlife or not.

by **TroutMaskReplica**

At current birth rates, Foundation projections estimate that by 2150, the number of humans piloted by souls will be outnumbered 5:1.
[[/div]]

[[div class="excerpt"]]
**[[[SCP-4051]]]:** //Your Friendly Neighborhood Keter//
by **Nagiros**
----
SCP-4051 is a male humanoid which can create temporary Class-E wormholes to extradimensional spaces populated by a theoretically infinite number of a unique item. Efforts to utilize it to the Foundation's benefit are ongoing.
[[/div]]

[[div class="excerpt"]]
**[[[SCP-4260]]]:** The Subdirective
by **Nagiros**
----
SCP-4260 refers to the consciousness of an essophysical entity which has permeated itself through the known universe. The effect of SCP-4260's existence has been well documented by almost every sapient culture.
[[/div]]

[[div class="excerpt"]]
**[*/apas Automated Passive Amnestization System Ver. 17.09]**
by **Nagiros**
----
[[module CSS]]
div.terminal {
  margin-bottom: 1em;
  border: solid 3px #BBBBBB;
  border-radius: 16px;
  background-color: #131;
  background-image: radial-gradient(ellipse 1000% 100% at 50% 90%, transparent, #121); /* black shadow at the top of the terminal */
  background-position: center;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 10em 1em rgba(0,0,0,0.5); /* shadow around the terminal */
  overflow: hidden; /* prevents scanline from forming a scrollwheel */
  color: rgba(128,255,128,0.8);
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: 1.45em;
  padding: 0 1em;
}
[[/module]]

[[div class="terminal"]]
Your current version of the Automated Passive Amnestization System (APAS), installed at Site-17, is up to date and all systems are online. What now?
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="white-space excerpt hub"]]
**[[[white space (HUB)]]]**
----
The future is more bleak than you could possibly imagine. It is an unconscious hellscape, a continuation of the present, a birthplace of the static sky above the port. The Foundation â€” if it can be called that at this stage in its mutation â€” has entered its endgame.

Fortunately, this hell won't last much longer.
[[/div]]

[[div class="admonition excerpt notation hub"]]
**[*/admonition ADMONITION (HUB)]**
by **Liryn, Placeholder McD, et. al**

----

= //To control everything is to control nothing; as one's dominion increases, so too is it stretched thin.//

= [[span class="bt"]]Everything will be as it should.[[/span]]
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="section-header"]]
+* Canon Details
[[/div]]

[[tabview]]
[[tab That Which Can Be Said]]

++* Beginnings

The first tenet of Site-17's fiction is that the Foundation is, at its core, evil. It is a hierarchical, bureaucratic institution which seeks to enforce ignorance as law and is plainly hostile to the world at large. It worships the greater ethical good but has no method of defining what that good is.

Perhaps, the researchers within the Foundation have not realized this. Perhaps even the Overseers are likewise deluded. But the ones who have been trampled beneath the weight of the Foundation's transgressions are not so blind.

++* Middles

The second tenet is that Site-17's fiction runs on a vibe. Highly atmospheric and emotionally-driven, Deepwell presents a world defined by wrongness; institutions tasked with the safeguarding of humanity have taken on a certain malignancy. Control, prided by the Foundation as a central dogma, seems more and more every day like a facade to hide the unknown forces to which the men in charge have given themselves, and the world.

++* Continuations

Preferably, articles written for Site-17 should incorporate one or more of the following elements into their fiction:

* Inclusion of, or references to, established characters or events within the canon
* Ethics Committee interactions
* Thematic interest in secrecy, truth, and/or the sacrifices made to maintain the Veil

In any case, feel free to parent your article to this page and add it here when it's posted. The applicable tag is {{deepwell-catalog}}.

Note that the ADMONITION Series is set in an alternate continuity which runs on a similar vibe and thematic interest. It is currently closed to collaboration.

[[/tab]]
[[tab That Which Can Be Known]]

++ Essophysics

Essophysics is the study of embodiments. The ideas which govern our everyday are not really ours; reality bends to the wills of Intrinsic anomalies, fading in and out of reality alongside their concepts. None are all-powerful, all are subject to the discordancy of conceptualization, and all are mortal. Painfully, obviously mortal.

++ Timeline Of Important Events

This primarily exists as a vain attempt to ensure that characters born in 1990 don't become Site Directors in 1970. It's harder than you'd think!

----

**Warning:** Heavy spoilers.

[[=]]
[[collapsible show="+ Show Full Timeline" hide="- Hide Full Timeline" hideLocation="both"]]
[[<]]

||~ Date ||~ Event ||
|| 1906/06/08 || First humanoid anomaly, [[[SCP-6086]]], is contained. ||
|| 1910 || Creation of the Ethics Committee. ||
|| 1912/10/02 || [[[SCP-6086]]] is designated as neutralized. ||
|| 1987 || The Foundation notes the existence of [[[SCP-4755]]] but fails to determine its source or nature. ||
|| 1999/01/13 || Death is contained as [[[SCP-4260]]] after voluntarily manifesting and requesting medical assistance. ||
|| 2003 || [[[APAS | Apollyon]]] manifests for the first time and destroys Site-17, but is turned back by Dr. Skyler. Dr. Weathers is contracted as the Provisional Site Director. ||
|| 2005/05/13 || Irantu //Mark-LXXII// contacts the Foundation from the year 2103 CE regarding SCP-4755. ||
|| 2010/01/04 || Apollyon completes a manifestation event and exits the local timeline. ||
|| 2012/08 || Rainer Miller is contained as [[[SCP-4051]]]. ||
|| 2015/09/08 || [[[SCP-4175 | Alex Conrad]]] is neutralized. ||
|| 2016/02/13 || Foundation Administrator Ethan Horowitz becomes the heir to SCP-4260 in order to prevent a Î©K-Class ("End-of-Death") Scenario. ||
|| 2103 || The Foundation ascends to a Tier V conceptual anomaly, becoming SCP-4755. ||

[[/<]]
[[/collapsible]]
[[/=]]

Note that the ADMONITION Series is set in an alternate continuity which diverges from the above timeline on September 8, 2002. It is closed to collaboration, and its timeline will remain undisclosed so long as that is the case.

[[/tab]]
[[/tabview]]
